page.title: 17B.M.X. TRACK, IPSWICH
page.content: One of the most popular crazes enjoyed by young people in the 1980's is the art of B.M.X. riding.Specially built cycles allow fit young riders to perform stunts and take part in races. To cope with the overwhelming demand from youngsters in Ipswich, the local council built a B.M.X. track in Landseer Park (see page 18). This allows racing around steeply banked bends, jumps and special stunts to be performed. The track is so popular that it is well sign-posted on all major roads leading to the area. The expensive but necessary equipment that riders need to buy must have used up many birthdays,the hats, gloves, knee-pads, all go a long way to making the sport safe and spectacular.Will the craze last beyond the 1980's ?
